vague_description: A traveling salesman has dietary restrictions and preferences, and seeks a meal plan with minimal sodium intake while meeting calorie and protein requirements.
detailed_description: A travelling salesman only eats ramen and fries. Each pack of ramen contains \param{CaloriesRamen} calories, \param{ProteinRamen} grams of protein, and \param{SodiumRamen} mg of sodium. Each pack of fries contains \param{CaloriesFries} calories, \param{ProteinFries} grams of protein, and \param{SodiumFries} mg of sodium. Since fries are easier to eat while driving, at most \param{MaxRamenFraction} of his meals can be ramen. The salesman wants to ensure he eats at least \param{MinCalories} calories and \param{MinProtein} grams of protein. How many of each should he eat to minimize his sodium intake?
target_objective: Minimize the total sodium intake from the consumption of ramen and fries
target_constraints: Number of ramen packs is non-negative
Number of fries packs is non-negative
At most MaxRamenFraction of the total meals can be ramen
The salesman must eat at least MinCalories calories
The salesman must consume at least MinProtein grams of protein
target_parameters: Calories contained in each pack of ramen
Protein contained in each pack of ramen
Sodium contained in each pack of ramen
Calories contained in each pack of fries
Protein contained in each pack of fries
Sodium contained in each pack of fries
Maximum fraction of meals that can be ramen
